Alexandria.District of Columbia War Memorial:
The District of Columbia War Memorial commemorates the citizens of the District of Columbia who served in World War I.


== History ==

As in the title, this memorial stands for World War I soldiers that fought and gave their lives. The memorial stands in West Potomac Park slightly off of Independence Avenue in a grove of trees. Authorized by an act of Congress on June 7, 1924, funds to construct the memorial were provided by the contributions of both organizations and individual citizens of the District.
